oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fort Cooper School, Hickman County
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gardner, Leigh Ann, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space; Finding Community
Towns, Neighborhoods; Schools
African American Schools
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fort Cooper was an African American community in Hickman County started by Nathan George, a former slave, circa 1870. George purchased 200 acres of land, and donated land for both a church and a school This school building likely dates to the 1930s.
